repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Rural Enterprise and Small-Scale
            Commercial Agriculture Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rural Enterprise and
            Small-Scale Commercial Agriculture Development Project for
            Armenia were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; the
            risk to development outcome was low or negligible; the
            Bank's performance was satisfactory; and the
            Borrower's performance was also satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: adopting a holistic approach and
            addressing the most relevant development priorities improves
            project impact. Early success builds on social capital and
            brings more support. If agricultural credit needs to be
            developed, interventions must follow the basic financial
            system rules for being effective and sustainable. Effective
            agricultural advisory systems are necessary catalysts in the
            process of improving small farm productivity and
            development. Funding of advisory services should be provided
            based on approved annual work plans. Community mobilization
            helps interventions to be more relevant to peoples'
            needs, giving them a voice at all levels.

Armenia - Rural Enterprise and Small-Scale
            Commercial Agriculture Development Project

14694841.trustfund:
TF053336-PHRD-ARMENIA: RURAL ECONOMY
            MODERNIZATION PROJECT,TF054738-PHRD-ARMENIA: RURAL ENTERPRISE

repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Rural Enterprise and Small-Scale
            Commercial Agriculture Development Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rural Enterprise
            and Small-Scale Commercial Agriculture Development Project
            is to support the development of Armenia's small and
            medium scale rural businesses by improving the ability of
            farmers and rural entrepreneurs to access markets and by
            stimulating market-oriented private and public investments
            in rural areas. All project activities have been completed
            or are nearly completed. As of end October, 2010, the
            project has disbursed 99.6 percent of total funds under the
            International Development Association  (IDA) credit 4095 AM,
            99.9 percent of the total funds under the IDA additional
            financing credit 4547 AM and 94 percent of total funds under
            the Japan Policy and Human Resources Development (PHRD)
            implementation grant TF 54738. Progress towards achieving
            the project development objective is rated as satisfactory.
            The reallocation is necessary to reflect the changes in the
            various categories as a result of expanding the grants for
            the community economic development component.

            Small-Scale Commercial Agriculture Development Project :
            restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Rural Enterprise and Small-Scale
            Commercial Agriculture Development Project : additional financing

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rural Enterprise
            and Small-Scale Commercial Agriculture Development Project
            is to support the development of Armenia's small and
            medium scale rural businesses by improving the ability of
            farmers and rural entrepreneurs to access markets and by
            stimulating market-oriented private and public investments
            in rural areas. The additional financing will enhance the
            project's impact and development effectiveness by
            increasing the total number of communities benefiting from
            project activities under the community-focused economic
            development (CED) component. It will generate additional
            employment, improve incomes, and access to services for a
            wider segment of Armenia's rural population than under
            the original project.

Armenia - Rural Enterprise and Small-Scale
            Commercial Agriculture Development Project : additional financing
